intro: Alsine aucheriana var. procera, commonly known as the tall alsike grass, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in spike-like clusters, which appear in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
